com.lehman.ic9.sys

Class timer

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Timer
      • com.lehman.ic9.sys.timer

  • public class timer
extends java.util.Timer
    Timer class implements a single use timer thread or a scheduled recurring timer. To implement a single use timer call the start() method. For a recurring timer use the startInterval() method.
    Author:
    Austin Lehman

      • timer

        public timer(ic9engine Eng,
             java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> OnTimeOut,
             long TimeoutMills)
        Constructor takes arguments to setup the timer and initializes the timer.
        Parameters:
        Eng - is an ic9engine instance.
        OnTimeOut - is a Javascript object to call on timeout.
        TimeoutMills - is a long int with the timeout in milliseconds.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the timer to run a single time.

      • startInterval

        public void startInterval(long Delay)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Starts the timer to run at the set timeout interval.
        Parameters:
        Delay - is a long int with the milliseconds delay to wait until the first run.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Exception

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the timer task.

      • restart

        public void restart()
             throws java.lang.Exception
        Restarts the timer if initially set to run a single time. (Started with start() method.)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Exception

      • setDuration

        public void setDuration(long TimeoutMills)
        Sets the timeout duration.
        Parameters:
        TimeoutMills - is a long int with the number of milliseconds for the timeout.

      • getDuration

        public long getDuration()
        Gets the timeout duration.
        Returns:
        A long int with the timeout duration.

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Checks to see if the timer is running.
        Returns:
        A boolean with true for running.
